question.text:
Blank & Cassell Office Supplies

55 Belmont Street, Denver, CO 80252

Phone: 720-555-0101

www.blanckandcassell.com

October 4
Elena Cardillo
124 Sagebrush Avenue, Apartment B3
Denver, CO 80033

Dear Ms. Cardillo,
To thank you for being such a loyal customer, we would like to invite you to become a member of our new Frequent Buyer Club. It is free to join and will help you save money on future purchases. Once enrolled, you will receive a 5 percent discount on all purchases in our Denver and Boulder stores. The only requirement for maintaining your membership is to make at least one purchase per year.
To sign up, simply complete and send in the enclosed form or visit our Web site at www.blanckandcassell.com.

Sincerely,
Isaac Grantway
Customer Service Representative
Enclosure
Why was the letter sent to Ms. Cardillo?
choices: (A) To announce an update to a website
(C) To confirm a recent o der

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "To thank you for being such a loyal customer, we would like to invite you to become a member of our new Frequent Buyer Club."

question.text: What was sent with the letter?

answer.explanation: You can see the information in: "To sign up, simply complete and send in the enclosed form or visit our Web site at www.blanckandcassell.com. "

question.text:
To: Sales Associates Team
From: Shein, Clifford
Date: November 22
Subject: Urgent matter

Dear Sales Associates,
The most recent edition at The Brooktown Weekly ran our advertisement with a misprint. It listed the end of our half-price sale as December 11 instead of December 1. While a correction will appear in the paper's next issue, it is to be expected that not all of our customers will be aware of the error. Therefore, if shoppers ask between December 2 and 11 about the sale, first apologize for the inconvenience and then offer them a coupon for 10% off any item they wish to purchase, either in the store or online.
Should customers have any further questions, please direct them to the floor manager. Thank you for your assistance in this matter.

Clifford Shein, General Manager, Williams Apparel
What is stated about The Brooktown Weekly?
choices: (A) It runs advertisements by Williams Apparel in every edition.
(B) It misidentified the last day of Williams Apparel’s promotional event.
(C) It will include discount coupons from Williams Apparel in its next edition.
(D) It apologized to the general manager of Williams Apparel for an inconvenience.

answer.text: (B) It misidentified the last day of Williams Apparel’s promotional event.
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "The most recent edition at The Brooktown Weekly ran our advertisement with a misprint. "

question.text: What does Mr. Shein ask the sales associates to do?
choices: (A) Refer customers to the company’s website for additional products
(B) Refer customers to the store’s advertisement in local newspapers
(C) Tell customers to discuss additional concerns with a supervisor
(D) Tell customers about a problem with a new product

answer.text: (C) Tell customers to discuss additional concerns with a supervisor
answer.explanation: The information is in: "Should customers have any further questions, please direct them to the floor manager. "

question.text:
Auckland Daily Chronicle

Business Briefs

AUCKLAND (6 June) - Ann Marie Haas, former executive director of Gear Good, a company that develops and sells software for bike-sharing companies, has a new but related position. —[1]—. Beginning in November, she will be general manager of City Wheels, a bike-sharing company in Auckland. — [2]—. The move comes at an opportune moment for both Ms. Haas and City Wheels. Ms. Haas had worked for Gear Good in Wellington since the company was founded five years ago but was yearning to return to Auckland, where she grew up. City Wheels was looking for a new leader to oversee its planned expansion from 50 to 75 bike stations in Auckland. —[3] —. “I’m thrilled to join a company that’s important to residents and tourists alike,” Ms. Haas said.
The City Wheels system is simple and affordable for occasional use. —[4] —. The first thirty minutes of biking are free, and after that, the cost is $4 per hour or $20 per day. Ms. Haas said she is enthusiastic about this venture, both for herself and for the city of Auckland. - Tahei Davis, Staff Writer
What is the purpose of the article?
choices: (A) To describe the financial difficulties a business is facing
(B) To announce the launch of a new software company
(C) To report on an executive's career move
(D) To assess recent tourism trends in Auckland

answer.text: (C) To report on an executive's career move
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "Ann Marie Haas, former executive director of Gear Good, a company that develops and sells software for bike-sharing companies, has a new but related position."

question.text: What does City Wheels expect to do?

answer.explanation: The information is in: "City Wheels was looking for a new leader to oversee its planned expansion from 50 to 75 bike stations in Auckland. "

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2, [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?
“A modest $5 registration fee is required to begin using City Wheels bikes.”

answer.explanation: The sentence after position [4] mentions the cost of hiring bike.

question.text:
Saponac State Park


Please note that www.newengIandcxplored.com, a popular commercial tourism website, lists 42 Millinockct Drive as the address of Saponac State Park. Be aware that this is the address for the park’s maintenance facilities, which are located on an unpaved road that is open only to park employees. The Saponac State Park Visitor Center and the official park entrance are located at 66 Debsconeag Way, about 32 miles from the maintenance building. Park visitors must use the park’s main entrance. All marked trails and guided walks begin in this area. From Elkdale, take Highway 82 north, use exit 558 for Ranch Road, and follow the signs approximately 8 miles to the park’s main entrance. All roads leading to the park’s main entrance are paved. For more information, call (207) 555-0117.
For whom is the notice most likely intended?

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "Please note that www.newengIandcxplored.com, a popular commercial tourism Web site, lists 42 Millinockct Drive as the address of Saponac State Park."

question.text: What is suggested about the website www.newenglandexplored.com?
choices: (C) It has information about parks in many countries.
(D) It was created by Saponac State Park employees.

answer.explanation: The information is in: "Please note that www.newengIandcxplored.com, a popular commercial tourism Web site, lists 42 Millinockct Drive as the address of Saponac State Park. Be aware that this is the address for the park’s maintenance facilities, which are located on an unpaved road that is open only to park employees."

question.text: What does the notice include?
choices: (B) Directions for driving to the park
(C) A list of current roadwork projects near the park

answer.text: (B) Directions for driving to the park
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "Park visitors must use the park’s main entrance. All marked trails and guided walks begin in this area. From Elkdale, take Highway 82 north, use exit 558 for Ranch Road, and follow the signs approximately 8 miles to the park’s main entrance. All roads leading to the park’s main entrance are paved."

question.text:
To: Hamza Darzi hdarzi@gady.net
From: Anna Leski leski@zengerproducts.com
Date: February 8
Re: Refresh 2000,

Dear Mr. Darzi,
Thank you for bringing our attention to the issues you have experienced with the Refresh 2000. We take pride in creating high-quality appliances, so we are taking steps to address your concerns immediately.
— [1] —. Since the date you purchased your unit, the Refresh 2000 has been redesigned and thoroughly tested. We have shipped one of these updated units to your home address. I am confident that the new version will remove dirt from your carpet to your satisfaction. — [2] —. If it does not, please contact our accounting office in Lakeside at 291-555-0177 for a full repayment of the purchase price. Additionally, we have just transferred all production to a larger building and are refining our manufacturing procedures. — [3] —.
Please let me know if there is anything else I can do. — [4] —. On behalf of Zenger, I apologize for the inconvenience this issue has caused, and I hope to serve you again soon.

Sincerely,
Anna Leski, Customer Care Representative
Zenger Household Products, Inc.
Eastern Regional Office
267 Kelley Avenue
Planterville, VA 42558
What is the purpose of the e-mail?
choices: (A) To provide details about a delivery
(C) To announce a new policy for return
(D) To inform an employee of process changes

answer.explanation: The information is in: "Thank you for bringing our attention to the issues you have experienced with the Refresh 2000. We take pride in creating high-quality appliances, so we are taking steps to address your concerns immediately."

question.text: What most likely is the Refresh 2000?

answer.explanation: You can infer the information from: "I am confident that the new version will remove dirt from your carpet to your satisfaction."

question.text: What is NOT offered as a solution to the problem?

answer.explanation:
(B) - If it does not, please contact our accounting office in Lakeside at 291-555-0177 for a full repayment of the purchase price.
(C) - We have shipped one of these updated units to your home address.
(D) - Additionally, we have just transferred all production to a larger building and are refining our manufacturing procedures.

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3], and [4] does the following sentence best belong?
Our quality control manager will visit the factory and observe those processes to ensure that nothing is being overlooked.”

answer.explanation: Because the sentence before position [3] mention about improving manufacturing procedures.

question.text:
Airport Expansion Continues

26 May – A major airport expansion project is under way in Onalia City. The project is estimated to cost $1,6 billion, and a new terminal is scheduled to open for international service in approximately one year.
The airport, however, sits on a confined piece of land, which presents significant challenges to increasing the number of takeoffs and landings. If the airport remains limited to its current two runways, the capacity to handle air traffic could be reached within three years.
To address the problem, officials overseeing the Onalia City Airport project have contracted a group of engineers from Wilford Engineering to explore the possibility of extending a third runway over the Pacific Ocean. The engineering firm will survey the area for six months before presenting their findings and recommending a plan of action.
Runways that extend over water are not unprecedented. This type of runway exists in places such as Gibraltar and Japan, which have faced similar challenges.
Why is Onalia City Airport undergoing an expansion?
choices: (A) To accommodate flights to other countries
(B) To provide service to a growing population in surrounding cities
(C) To compete with a nearby airport

answer.text: (A) To accommodate flights to other countries
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: <i>"If the airport remains limited to its current two runways, the capacity to handle air traffic could be reached within three years. To address the problem, officials overseeing the Onalia City Airport project have contracted a group of engineers from Wilford Engineering to explore the possibility of extending a third runway over the Pacific Ocean. "

question.text: In paragraph 2, line 5, the word “handle” is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: handle:  to deal with a situation, a person, an area of work or a strong emotion.

question.text: What has Wilford Engineering been hired to do?
choices: (A) To determine whether a potential runway site is suitable
(B) To develop a plan for increasing the size of the air traffic control tower
(C) To investigate how to improve traffic on roads leading to the airport
(D) To review expansion plans with officials in Gibraltar and Japan

answer.text: (A) To determine whether a potential runway site is suitable
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "To address the problem, officials overseeing the Onalia City Airport project have contracted a group of engineers from Wilford Engineering to explore the possibility of extending a third runway over the Pacific Ocean. The engineering firm will survey the area for six months before presenting their findings and recommending a plan of action."

question.text: What is suggested about Onalia City Airport?
choices: (A) It has been open for one year.
(B) It has earned $1.6 billion in revenue.
(D) It  is located on the coast.

answer.text: (D) It  is located on the coast.
answer.explanation: You can see the information in: "The airport, however, sits on a confined piece of land, which presents significant challenges to increasing the number of takeoffs and landings."

question.text:
Dubai Ecological Construction Expo

Exhibit Hall Rules

BADGE CONTROL

Admission to the exhibit hall is restricted to exhibitors from qualified companies, exposition attendees, and logistics personnel.

Badges are required on the floor at all limes, including during move-in and move-out days.
• Exhibitor badges will be given to the company’s primary contact for distribution to that exhibitor's personnel.
• The number of badges assigned to each exhibitor will be based on the size of booth space the company has rented.
• Anyone on the floor who is not officially registered will be evicted from the show.
• False certification of any individual as a company’s exhibition representative, or misuse of exhibitor badges, will be just cause for removing the exhibit from the floor.
What is the purpose of the policy statement?
choices: (B) To provide details about setting up exhibits
(C) To specify who is permitted in the exhibit hall
(D) To describe facilities that are available to participants

answer.text: (C) To specify who is permitted in the exhibit hall
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "Admission to the exhibit hall is restricted to exhibitors from qualified companies, exposition attendees, and logistics personnel."

question.text: How will individual team members obtain a badge?
choices: (A) They will receive badges from an expo official when they check in.
(B) They will print out badges directly from the expo registration Web page.
(C) Personalized badges will be sent to them in the mail.
(D) A company representative will pass out badges to them.

answer.text: (D) A company representative will pass out badges to them.
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "Exhibitor badges will be given to the company’s primary contact for distribution to that exhibitor's personnel.

question.text: What must a company do to increase the number of employees working at its exhibit?
choices: (A) Rent a larger space for its exhibit
(C) Apply for an exemption to the staff limit
(D) Speak directly to an expo representative

answer.text: (A) Rent a larger space for its exhibit
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "The number of badges assigned to each exhibitor will be based on the size of booth space the company has rented."
